ext_description.p: A Contact_size_dependent_land is a type of whose shape is dependent on the size of the contact area of the that will be joined to the Contact_size_dependent_land in the assembly. A Contact_size_dependent_land is a feature in the design view that is designed to implement an interface terminal of an interconnect. Each Contact_size_dependent_land has a Component_terminal_to_interconnect_module_interface_terminal_assignment that associates the Contact_size_dependent_land with the Interconnect_module_interface_terminal that is the usage view feature. The location of the Contact_size_dependent_land is dependent on the location of the Interconnect_module_interface_terminal it is associated with. The location is represented by a Dependently_located_layer_connection_point that references the Interconnect_module_interface_terminal as it's associated_design_object. In the case that there is a Conductive_interconnect_element connected to the Contact_size_dependent_land, the location of the Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal co-located with the Contact_size_dependent_land is also defined by that same Dependently_located_layer_connection_point.
ext_description.example: Figure 1 is a detail that illustrates the Contact_size_dependent_land in relationship to the terminal that mates with it.

note.p: The path from the Contact_size_dependent_land to a Conductive_interconnect_element implementing internal connectivity is:

The path traverses the Component_terminal_to_interconnect_module_interface_terminal_assignment and also the Dependently_located_layer_connection_point. The path is represented with the mapping table syntax defined in clause 5 of this part of ISO 10303.

ext_description.note: There are no more than two Component_terminal_to_interconnect_module_interface_terminal_assignment for each Contact_size_dependent_land. In most scenarios there is exactly one Component_terminal_to_interconnect_module_interface_terminal_assignment for each Contact_size_dependent_land. There may be several Conductive_interconnect_element or Area_component associated with a Contact_size_dependent_land.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies a role of the for the Contact_size_dependent_land.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Contact_size_dependent_land is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Contact_size_dependent_land as its . There shall be one or two Land_interface_terminals for a Contact_size_dependent_land.

ext_description.p:
An Inter_stratum_feature_dependent_land is a type of included in the design to provide mechanical support to an Inter_stratum_feature or included in the design to provide a connection to an Inter_stratum_feature. An Inter_stratum_feature_dependent_land is either a
or an .

note.p: In the case that an Inter_stratum_feature_dependent_land is included in the design to support electrical connectivity and a Conductive_interconnect_element is attached to the Inter_stratum_feature_dependent_land, the path from the Inter_stratum_feature_dependent_land to the Conductive_interconnect_element is:
The path traverses the Dependently_located_layer_connection_point. The path representation uses the syntax from Clause 5 of this part of ISO 10303.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Inter_stratum_feature_dependent_land.

ext_description.p:
A Land is a type of that is provided to support explicit geometric based interfaces to the wiring pattern on a layer in an interconnect or to provide mechanical support to a vertical structure. A Land may be a , or an . A Land helps compose a
or a .
ext_description.note: The functional attribute provides a means to determine if a Land is included to provide an interface to a wiring pattern.

example.p: Figure 22 of ISO/TS 10303-1698 illustrates a padstack that contains a Land.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:

for the Land. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
specifies the primary role of the
for the Land.
ext_description.note: The allows an application to discover the derived_from for the Land through the .. path.
